Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 27, 2004 be adopted and printed by Council Member Recchia.
Items.MinutesNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 27, 2004 be adopted and printed by Council Member Recchia.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor  -  "AN ACT relating to providing accidental and special accidental death benefits, a line-of-duty award and health insurance coverage to eligible survivors of a certain member of the uniformed force of the New York city fire department who was killed in action while serving in Iraq as a member of the Army National Guard." A.11892 / S.7797
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Providing accidental and special accidental death benefits (S.7797/A.11892)

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 124-A, in relation to the requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections, the requirements of transition and inauguration entities for candidates elected to the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council, participation in the New York City Campaign Finance Program by self-funded candidates, the debate program, and limiting the use of government resources during an election year.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. No. 124-A, Requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 371-A, in relation to application of contribution limits of the New York City Campaign Finance Program to all candidates for the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council, and prohibiting candidates from accepting contributions, loans or security for such loans from corporations.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. No. 371-A, Selected requirements of the NYC Campaign Finance Program.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 466-A, in relation to application of the public disclosure requirements of the New York City Campaign Finance Program to all candidates for the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. No. 466-A, Application of selected requirements of the NYC Campaign Finance Program.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Health

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make nurses available to public and private primary and intermediate schools.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Overridden by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Make available a nurse to all public /private primary and intermediate schools on a full-time basis

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 207-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make nurses available to public and private primary and intermediate schools.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Filed by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. 207-A, Make available a nurse to all public /private primary and intermediate schools on a full-time basis

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State legislature to take swift action to pass legislation that would require courts in New York State to advise defendants facing felony, misdemeanor or violation charges that a plea of guilty may result in deportation, exclusion from admission or denial of naturalization and that would provide real remedies for defendants if advisement does not occur.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tem (The Majority Leader, Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tem (The Majority Leader, Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 7 Council Members voted against this item: Council Members Gallagher, Gentile, Lanza, McMahon, Provenzano, Vallone Jr. and Oddo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote
Items.MatterName: Amending Criminal Procedure Law

Introduction & Reading of Bills

Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling upon the federal government to only purchase military uniforms made wholly in the United States, and to give New York City its fair share of military uniform purchasing contracts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Federal government to only purchase military uniforms made wholly in the US.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming a street David Michael Ruddle Street, in the Borough of the Bronx.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Name Change, David Michael Ruddle Street, Bronx

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the U.S. Congress and President Bush to immediately adopt all the recommendations of the 9/11 Commission that affect the allocation of homeland security funding to New York City and address problems with the city’s emergency command and communication protocol.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Immediately adopt all the recommendations of the 9/11 Commission.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the Campaign for Fiscal Equity, the law firm of Simpson, Thatcher & Bartlett and all those who have worked with them for their continuing advocacy for the children of the City of New York, and calling upon the Governor and the State Legislature to fully and fairly provide the means to insure that all New York City school children immediately receive a sound basic education.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Commending the Campaign for Fiscal Equity

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon New York State Governor George Pataki to grant executive clemency to Ms. Sharon Richardson, who, during her 14 years of incarceration, has participated in countless rehabilitating programs, humanitarian activities and educational initiatives, thus proving herself to be deserving of clemency.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Grant executive clemency to Ms. Sharon Richardson.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to vest the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene with authority to inspect and enforce regulations governing the operations of slaughterhouses in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Dep't of Health and Mental Hygiene with authority to inspect and enforce regulations governing the operations of slaughterhouses.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of Assembly bill A.02835, sponsored by Assemblyman Richard Gottfried, to amend the New York State Urban Development Corporation Act in relation to subjecting various actions the Urban Development Corporation is authorized to take respecting real property to the provisions of Section 197-c of the New York City Charter and calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact this legislation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYS Urban Development Corporation Act.

Items.Title: Resolution pursuant to Section 19-511.1 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York to review one hundred thirteen determinations by the Taxi and Limousine Commission to approve applications for the renewal of a license to operate a base station.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Base Station License Review

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring callers to the 311 system to identify themselves by name and address if the nature of their complaint requires the dispatch of the Police Department, Fire Department or EMS, and making it a crime if such call is a false report.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring callers to the 311 system to identify themselves by name and address.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the responsibility of an owner, lessee, tenant or person in charge of a vacant lot to maintain such lot and adjacent areas.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Responsibility of an owner, lessee, tenant or person in charge of a vacant lot to maintain such lot and adjacent areas.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing signage requiring lower speeds and other pedestrian-friendly actions when operators of any form of transportation are within one block of a naturally occurring retirement community or one block of a senior citizens center.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Providing signage requiring lower speeds and other pedestrian-friendly actions around retirement community or senior citizens center.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation and licensing of residential contractors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Regulation and licensing of residential contractors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to auditing and implementing diversity and eradicating discrimination in all City operations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Auditing and implementing diversity and eradicating discrimination in all City operations.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the granting of an exemption from real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the real property tax law, for the parcel owned by Congregation Avnei Pinchos known as 5822 17th Avenue in the City of New York, borough of Brooklyn, being designated on the tax map as block 5503, lot 52 and 53 in such borough, and the cancellation of taxes, fines, penalties and interest remaining unpaid, and the making of appropriate correction of the subject assessment roll, if, upon accepting and reviewing the application or renewal application for such exemption, the Department of Finance is satisfied that such corporation or association would otherwise be entitled to such exemption if it had filed such application for exemption by the appropriate taxable status date, in accordance with Chapter 326 of the laws of 2003.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tem (The Majority Leader, Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Presidenrt Pro Tem (The Majority Leader, Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote
Items.MatterName: Approving the granting of an exemption from real property taxes, Congregation Avnei Pinchos known as 5822 17th St, NY.
